output_list.reason: The owner() function allows anyone to view the contract's owner, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The setOwner(address newOwner) function allows anyone to set the contract's owner, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The setPrices(uint256 newSellPrice, uint256 newBuyPrice) function is public and allows unauthorized access to set the prices.
The buyAndBurn(address target, uint256 amount) function allows anyone to buy and burn tokens on behalf of another user, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The burnFrom(address target, uint256 amount) function allows anyone to burn tokens on behalf of another user, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The mintToken(address target, uint256 mintedAmount) function allows anyone to mint tokens on behalf of another user, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The freezeAccount(address target, bool freeze) function allows anyone to freeze or unfreeze an account, which can be exploited by attackers to take control of the contract.
The buy() function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of the contract to any value.
The sell() function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of the contract to any value.
The burn() function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of the contract to any value.
